_comment: Created by EFisher on 12/10/2015 14:31:19 using v2.7
title: How has the proportion of Red 1 and 2 calls attended within 8 minutes varied by commissioning region?
analysis_commentary:
The Government requires that 75% of Category A (life-threatening) calls should have be attended within eight minutes.

The proportion of category A calls attended within eight minutes varies at the regional level in a similar manner to the national level, although London has a tendency to more extreme peaks and troughs. There have only been three occasions since April 2014 where an area has achieved the target of attending 75% of Category A calls within eight minutes. London's performance encountered a particularly challenging period between April 2014 and May 2015, going below 50% in December 2014.
data_source: NHS England, Ambulance Quality Indicators: System Indicators
